resources package

Submodules

resources.custom_user_events module

Communication with the microcontroller is event based.

Certain device controls are also event based.

This file contains my custom defined events.

resources.global_functions_old module

resources.mappings module

The RaspberryPi and MCU communicate by exchanging pre-determined codes over wired/bluetooth serial connections.

Each functopm (output or input) is represented by unique identifier.

resources.my_logging module

# This code is from the following github user: # ——————————————————————————- # - # Python dual-logging setup (console and log file), - # supporting different log levels and colorized output - # - # Created by Fonic <https://github.com/fonic> - # Date: 04/05/20 - 02/07/23 - # - # Based on: - # https://stackoverflow.com/a/13733863/1976617 - # https://uran198.github.io/en/python/2016/07/12/colorful-python-logging.html - # https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code#Colors - # - # ——————————————————————————-

class resources.my_logging.LogFormatter(color, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: Formatter

Logging formatter supporting colorized output

COLOR_CODES = {10: '\x1b[1;37m', 20: '\x1b[1;37m', 30: '\x1b[1;33m', 40: '\x1b[1;31m', 50: '\x1b[1;35m'}
RESET_CODE = '\x1b[0m'
format(record, *args, **kwargs)

Format the specified record as text.

The record’s attribute dictionary is used as the operand to a string formatting operation which yields the returned string. Before formatting the dictionary, a couple of preparatory steps are carried out. The message attribute of the record is computed using LogRecord.getMessage(). If the formatting string uses the time (as determined by a call to usesTime(), formatTime() is called to format the event time. If there is exception information, it is formatted using formatException() and appended to the message.

resources.my_logging.set_up_logging(console_log_output, console_log_level, console_log_color, logfile_file, logfile_log_level, logfile_log_color, log_line_template)
resources.my_logging.shivams_logging(script_name='tricorder', console_log_level='debug', logfile_log_level='debug')
